properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: domain_name
properties.description: (Required) A domain name for which the certificate should be issued

properties.name: subject_alternative_names
properties.description: (Optional) A list of domains that should be SANs in the issued certificate

properties.name: validation_method
properties.description: (Required) Which method to use for validation. DNS or EMAIL are valid, NONE can be used for certificates that were imported into ACM and then into Terraform.

properties.name: domain_name
properties.description: (Required) A domain name for which the certificate should be issued

properties.name: subject_alternative_names
properties.description: (Optional) A list of domains that should be SANs in the issued certificate

properties.name: validation_method
properties.description: (Required) Which method to use for validation. DNS or EMAIL are valid, NONE can be used for certificates that were imported into ACM and then into Terraform.

properties.name: private_key
properties.description: (Required) The certificate's PEM-formatted private key

properties.name: certificate_body
properties.description: (Required) The certificate's PEM-formatted public key

properties.name: certificate_chain
properties.description: (Optional) The certificate's PEM-formatted chain

properties.name: private_key
properties.description: (Required) The certificate's PEM-formatted private key

properties.name: certificate_body
properties.description: (Required) The certificate's PEM-formatted public key

properties.name: certificate_chain
properties.description: (Optional) The certificate's PEM-formatted chain

properties.name: tags
properties.description: (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: certificate_arn
properties.description: (Required) The ARN of the certificate that is being validated.

properties.name: validation_record_fqdns
properties.description: (Optional) List of FQDNs that implement the validation. Only valid for DNS validation method ACM certificates. If this is set, the resource can implement additional sanity checks and has an explicit dependency on the resource that is implementing the validation

properties.name: timeouts
properties.description: » Timeouts
acm_certificate_validation provides the following Timeouts configuration options:

properties.name: create
properties.description: (Default 45m) How long to wait for a certificate to be issued.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: certificate_authority_configuration
properties.description: (Required) Nested argument containing algorithms and certificate subject information. Defined below.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Whether the certificate authority is enabled or disabled. Defaults to true.

properties.name: revocation_configuration
properties.description: (Optional) Nested argument containing revocation configuration. Defined below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies a key-value map of user-defined tags that are attached to the certificate authority.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Optional) The type of the certificate authority. Currently, this must be SUBORDINATE.

properties.name: permanent_deletion_time_in_days
properties.description: (Optional) The number of days to make a CA restorable after it has been deleted, must be between 7 to 30 days, with default to 30 days.

properties.name: certificate_authority_configuration-1
properties.description: » certificate_authority_configuration

properties.name: key_algorithm
properties.description: (Required) Type of the public key algorithm and size, in bits, of the key pair that your key pair creates when it issues a certificate. Valid values can be found in the ACM PCA Documentation.

properties.name: signing_algorithm
properties.description: (Required) Name of the algorithm your private CA uses to sign certificate requests. Valid values can be found in the ACM PCA Documentation.

properties.name: subject
properties.description: (Required) Nested argument that contains X.500 distinguished name information. At least one nested attribute must be specified.

properties.name: subject-1
properties.description: » subject
Contains information about the certificate subject. Identifies the entity that owns or controls the public key in the certificate. The entity can be a user, computer, device, or service.

properties.name: common_name
properties.description: (Optional) Fully qualified domain name (FQDN) associated with the certificate subject.

properties.name: country
properties.description: (Optional) Two digit code that specifies the country in which the certificate subject located.

properties.name: distinguished_name_qualifier
properties.description: (Optional) Disambiguating information for the certificate subject.

properties.name: generation_qualifier
properties.description: (Optional) Typically a qualifier appended to the name of an individual. Examples include Jr. for junior, Sr. for senior, and III for third.

properties.name: given_name
properties.description: (Optional) First name.

properties.name: initials
properties.description: (Optional) Concatenation that typically contains the first letter of the given_name, the first letter of the middle name if one exists, and the first letter of the surname.

properties.name: locality
properties.description: (Optional) The locality (such as a city or town) in which the certificate subject is located.

properties.name: organization
properties.description: (Optional) Legal name of the organization with which the certificate subject is affiliated.

properties.name: organizational_unit
properties.description: (Optional) A subdivision or unit of the organization (such as sales or finance) with which the certificate subject is affiliated.

properties.name: pseudonym
properties.description: (Optional) Typically a shortened version of a longer given_name. For example, Jonathan is often shortened to John. Elizabeth is often shortened to Beth, Liz, or Eliza.

properties.name: state
properties.description: (Optional) State in which the subject of the certificate is located.

properties.name: surname
properties.description: (Optional) Family name. In the US and the UK for example, the surname of an individual is ordered last. In Asian cultures the surname is typically ordered first.

properties.name: title
properties.description: (Optional) A title such as Mr. or Ms. which is pre-pended to the name to refer formally to the certificate subject.

properties.name: revocation_configuration-1
properties.description: » revocation_configuration

properties.name: crl_configuration
properties.description: (Optional) Nested argument containing configuration of the certificate revocation list (CRL), if any, maintained by the certificate authority. Defined below.

properties.name: crl_configuration-1
properties.description: » crl_configuration

properties.name: custom_cname
properties.description: (Optional) Name inserted into the certificate CRL Distribution Points extension that enables the use of an alias for the CRL distribution point. Use this value if you don't want the name of your S3 bucket to be public.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Optional) Boolean value that specifies whether certificate revocation lists (CRLs) are enabled. Defaults to false.

properties.name: expiration_in_days
properties.description: (Required) Number of days until a certificate expires. Must be between 1 and 5000.

properties.name: s3_bucket_name
properties.description: (Optional) Name of the S3 bucket that contains the CRL. If you do not provide a value for the custom_cname argument, the name of your S3 bucket is placed into the CRL Distribution Points extension of the issued certificate. You must specify a bucket policy that allows ACM PCA to write the CRL to your bucket.
